alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 04 at 1:05PM MST until April 05 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Across northeastern Arizona, including Tuba City, Kayenta, Teec Nos Pos, Polacca, Winslow, and St. Johns. Winds will also be strong across the Kaibab Plateau. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 7 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. In addition, winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Localized areas of power outages are also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust resulting in reduced visibility is likely across northeast Arizona, including portions of I-40 from Winslow to the New Mexico border. The strong winds and dry conditions will also increase the fire threat for grassy areas.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
